name: Hotel Sunroute Plaza Shinjuku

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm glad I booked this hotel during our stay in Tokyo. It's about a 5-10 min walk to the Shinjuku train station which gives you access to all the major subway/JR/private lines in Tokyo. The rooms and bathrooms are very clean, although a bit small but everything else makes it perfect. The staff is helpful and there is an onsite luggage delivery service, which is handy if you are looking to travel to other places in Japan. The hotel is also near many restaurants so you won't have any trouble finding stuff to eat. Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Great hotel, Great location
This is a great hotel for a visit to Tokyo
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel during a two week visit to Japan, the hotel is obviously fairly new and looks really nice. The bedrooms and bathroom are spotless. Each room has free broadband access as standard which is useful. The rooms were bigger than I expected and certainly comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this hotel was perfect, it is like 100m from the Main Shinjuku station which means getting in addition the reception desk was staffed by about 6 people, so never a queue.
reviews.title: Very good choice

reviews.text: Pro:
reviews.title: Absolute superb hotel!!!
Highly Recommended
reviews.text: - modern buliding and facilities
This is very good value for money: I paid Euro 115 for a fully equipped twin room, with a lovely modern decor.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, but...

reviews.text: Unfortunately, we had to choose a smoking room because the no-smoking rooms were fully booked and our room had a terrible smoke smell which ruined our stay. So, be aware of this possible problem.
reviews.title: Four star hotel with five star service and ambience

reviews.text: The hotel has also a very nice common room with a good selection of free hot beverages and with two PCs connected to the internet, available at no charge.
reviews.title: Love this hotel, highly recommended!

reviews.text: If you like Shinjiuku, the hotel's location is great, very close to subway and train stations.
reviews.title: New, Clean Modern Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is fantastic, when it says it is 2-5 mins walk to the train station, it really is! The hotel has a beautiful lobby, the rooms are very small as expected in Japan. They are clean and comfortable. The staff are more than willing to help, and will give you a list of attractions and how to get there etc. Some of the staff speak english more fluently than others but they will do what they can to help. I reccomend the Segafredo just down the road for both coffee and the egg and bacon roll for breakfast. Coffee in japan can be dreadful if you dont go to the right place...McDonalds is also about15 meters of the hotel if you aren't partial to traditional japanese food. We had a great time, and staying in Shinjuku was a great base to get to a lot of areas.
reviews.title: Very nice!!

reviews.text: We booked this hotel on Travelocity, which at the time had a "Good Buy" sale for an economy double room for $92 a night. It was definitely a steal! The hotel is very new and had a boutique hotel feel, with dark woods and minimalist design and furniture. The staff was top notch and spoke English very well. We didn't try the two restaurants inside the hotel but it seemed like they were well-visited (and pricey).
reviews.title: Got lucky!

reviews.text: Its location just meters away from Shinjuku's South Entrance made it easy to get around (there's also an elevator right behind the hotel's street-level sign that goes down to the subway). Another big plus is that the Airport Limousine Bus stops right in the hotel driveway which made getting to Narita much easier.
reviews.title: Outstanding hotel for 1st time & repeat visitors

likes.liked: — 2 minute walk to JR Shinjuku station, shower pressure, dollar-to-Yen converter, cheap beer in vending machines, clean new hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room on the 6th floor and noise wasn't an issue. The bathroom was larger than expected. There is also a small business center with two computers and free Internet access, as well as a small coffee/tea bar. Overall, a great value!
reviews.title: Good choice in Tokyo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot stress enough how wonderful the Sunroute Plaza Shinjuku Hotel was for our week's stay during the New Years. It was super efficient, AFFORDABLE, clean, new, aesthetically pleasing, and had very courteous workers.
reviews.title: Shinjuku, I Love You-ku

likes.disliked: — Smallish rooms, but heck you should be out and about anyway!

reviews.text: My colleague and I booked a three night stay at the Sunroute Plaza Shinjuku Hotel after a three week business trip to Okinawa. The hotel is excellently situated right in the heart of Shinjuku. It is located within 1-2 blocks of Shinjuku Station and adjacent to the Shinjuku stop on the Toei Oedo Subway Line (stop E-27). Combine this with the multitude of shopping and eating establishment surrounding the hotel and you have a hotel stay well worth the price of the room.
reviews.title: Perfect Base Hotel

likes.liked: — close proximity to transportation and food option

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Transportation to the hotel from Narita Airport is easy; just use the Airport Limosine. My colleague and I waited for the shuttle that drops off directly at the hotel, but there are so many drop off points that taking one to a nearby hotel would have been much faster. The shuttle to the Sunroute Plaza only runs one an hour or so.
reviews.title: Very good choice for Tokyo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were small (of course) but that was no problem as we only were in them to sleep and shower. I mean, there was enough room for one person in the economy sized room....no more. Rooms were very nice and clean and had a desk with free internet connection and a modern flat screen TV. The bed was extremely comfortable too.
reviews.title: Exceeded expectations, fantastic location!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in the restaurant once for breakfast. The food wasn't that good, and I think it was somewhat expensive. I don't suggest wasting the money because there are so many other places just outside the doors that finding a breakfast or early morning snack isn't that hard. There is an AM/PM located across the street. You can also buy breakfast in one of the basements of the many department stores in the area. There wasn't much in the way of tourist infrastructure at the hotel. We booked a Mt. Fuji tour that left from a close by hotel and they were more sufficiently stocked with maps and brochures. The staff at the Sunroute Plaza were all very friendly and they were helpful whenever we would ask for directions.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel for Tourists
Nice business hotel, very good location
reviews.text: For those who have not been to Shinjuku before, the area is quite busy during the day and probably a lot busier at night. It seems like there is always a crowd at any time of day. The area is filled with shopping and eating options...my preference was for eating establishments. There is a small concentration of narrow alleyways one block north of the Sunroute Plaza. Here you can find delicious restaurants serving all types of Japanese cuisine along with some Korean and Chinese foods. Mixed in with the restaurants and bars are stores and shops where vendors stand outside and yell to prospective customers about what they may find inside. It is also quite close to Nishi-Shinjuku or the skyscraper district. Here you can find the Tokyo Government Building and a lot of other tall structures. This is also the home of the new Mode Gakuen Cocoon Building which was nearing completing when we were there.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was ideal for a first-time visit to Tokyo. The airport limo took us straight from Narita to the hotel, and was on time and fast both coming to the city and leaving. The hotel itself is in a great location: In the busy, lively Shinjuku but located on a relatively quiet sidestreet with a convenience store, restaurants and cafes nearby.
reviews.title: Perfect location

likes.disliked: — Small rooms; lack of storage space

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The decor is very modern and sleek, and I would recommend the breakfast, especially if you're going to be needing a lot of energy for the rest of the day. The rooms are small, it's true, but it was enough space for two with not-too-much luggage.
reviews.title: Good Bargain, Great Locale

reviews.text: Nice TV in the room, as well, HDTV and lots of channels in many languages. Showers also had good pressure, and maids were consistent and efficient. Bonus: free newspapers in both English and Japanese, with helpful staff to boot.
reviews.title: Great location and price

reviews.text: I agree with the other reviews, small but comfortable rooms, pleasant staff, awesome location. I was just going to add some tips: the breakfast at the hotel is quite pricey. There is a nice affordable coffee shop across the street where you can get coffee or tea and pastries and sandwiches (cafe veloce). We ate there every morning and enjoyed our time among the folk - people watching. Also, you can bill the hotel restaurant meals to your room if you ask. The reason this was convenient was that we ran out of cash and the hotel won't cash traveller's checks for you but the citibank in the tower next door (19th floor) with do this for you.
reviews.title: A nice surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a really convenient location near the Shinjuku subway and JR stations. It is also located near lots of shopping and nightlife.
reviews.title: Pleasant experience at Sunroute Plaza

reviews.text: The airport limo bus dropped us of in front of the hotel after an hour drive from Narita. The main lobby is very modern. Of the many people available for check-in, I noticed only 2 people who could speak fluent English.
reviews.title: Will stay here again

likes.disliked: — No place to put your clothes and beds were hard

reviews.title: Best value in Shinjuku
reviews.text: We had 2 rooms which were very clean and modern. Both rooms had ethernet cable for our laptops. There was a nice sized flat screen TV and a wide assortment of Japanese channels. There was a long desk along the window. This was also where the hot water pot, free tea, tea mugs, and mini refrigerator was located. My husband prefers coffee every morning so he bought a small jar of instant coffee at the 7-11 down the street.

My husband & I had the room with the double bed which was a little on the small side. It did not have a closet or dresser. There was a clothes rod hung by the door with a few hangers which I used. My husband lived out of his suitcase. We had brought two 21" suitcases, anything larger would have made the room difficult to navigate around.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

reviews.text: My children (17, 20) had a room with 2 twin beds. Their room was a little larger and even had a small closet. I asked that their room be close to ours, & this was accomplished w/o any problems.
reviews.title: Exactly what I expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location just 5 min. from the south exit of Shinjuku station. There are a lot of restaurants and shopping "malls" like Takashimaya Times Square, Odakyu, and Keio. These places also have large food markets if you just want to have a meal or dessert in your room. (They'll provide you w/ eating utensils if you ask.) We spent our first night walking the vibrant restaurant alleys a couple of blocks from the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel: wonderful service, excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: after reading all the other reviews for this hotel,i decided to book this hotel for my japan trip. It is easily accessible from the airport, just take the airport lumisine bus, it stop right infront of the main door... The hotel is clean, infact, extremely clean. The stuff were friendlly and helpful. A must have for shoppers, as train station is just besid the hotel, major shopping centres like tAKASHIMAYA and ISETAN or, major electronic shop YODOBASHI and there is one more, but i forgot, these shops are all just in a few mins walk~~i will definitely stay in this hotel again or my future trip to tokyo... Superb Hotel...HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
reviews.title: The best hotel i've ever stayed

likes.liked: — easily accessible and major shopping centres around in just few minutes walk
likes.disliked: — I LOVE EVERYTHING ABOUT THE ACCOMMODATION

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: WOW!
reviews.title: Excelent brand new hotel

reviews.text: We staye at this hotel during their first aniversary and it was amazing.
reviews.title: Excellent location!

reviews.text: Just 5 minutes from Shinjuku station which would take you anywhere.
reviews.title: very nice hotel with great location
All the good reviews are true
reviews.text: The hotel was on a very calm streen in Shinjuku so no noise was heard during the night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Sunroute only a couple of weeks ago. It was a great hotel, and I loved staying there. The lobby and hallways are attractive and elegant. They have a guest lounge with TV, 2 computers with free internet use, and a free tea/coffee machine.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: The room was small, but that was expected in Tokyo. I booked an "economy double" via Expedia at a great deal (A$114 per night), which turned out to be what the Sunroute call a "semi-double". This is a double bed (140cm wide) with about 2 metres around the edge of the bed, which had one side against the wall. This turned out to be fine, we just made sure to put our suitcases under the desk when we got ready in the morning. The room also had a fairly big TV with Japanese channels, plus one channel each in Chinese, Korean and English (CNN). But one of the Japanese channels often had English-language movies on at night, if you're interested. As for us, we didn't spend much time in the room.
reviews.title: A satisfactory hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was of a reasonable size, and really clean, with a shower-in-bath dealie, and those fabulous Japanese toilets with the warm seat etc. One thing I loved is that they provide you with just about everything you could need while travelling - toothbrushes, toothpaste, hairbrush, razor - plus, they have big pump-containers of shampoo, conditioer, bodywash and Shiseido face cleanser. You don't really have to bring a thing!
reviews.title: Great hotel in great location for decent price

likes.disliked: — No fan in the bathroom, resulting in a very steamy shower

reviews.text: The staff were very helpful and friendly. They allowed us to check in when we arrived a little earlier than the regular check-in time of 2pm. Many of them spoke English (but it helped that I knew how to ask in Japanese if they did), and 2 helped us by making reservations in Japanese to restaurants. And they allow you to leave your luggage if your flight leaves later in the day after you check out.
reviews.title: Superb value

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is great - the Shinjuku subway station is literally next door, and the JR Shinjuku station is only a 5 minute walk, where you can get the Narita Express to the airport, or any number of train lines if you have a JR Pass.
reviews.title: sunroute plaza shinjuku-stay there

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for five days with family, and thought that although the rooms were quite small they were very nicely furnished and modern, as well as exceptionally clean. The proximity to shinjuku station was incredible, yet the rooms were very quiet at night, whilst I thought that the guest-only lounge with computers and hot drinks was a very nice touch. Although it did not have a swimming pool I would chose it over all of the other 3 star hotels in central Tokyo, and most of the 4 star ones.
reviews.title: Better than modern

likes.liked: — The guest-only lounge with business facilities, and its proximity to shinjuku station

reviews.text: My friend and I stayed here for the beginning of our trip around Japan. Having just arrived in a foreign country, without any language skills, we easily made our way here from Tokyo Station. Simply take the Chuo line, which cuts through the Tokyo city loop and get off at Shinjuku station (about 10mins if it's the express). At the station's south exit, turn right and head towards the large intersection. Cross left at the intersection, then right so you end up diagonally across from the station exit. You'll see a McDonalds down the street. The hotel is just a little past McDonalds. The walk will take you about 5 mins.
reviews.title: Decent Hotel

likes.liked: — Great service, impeccably clean, great restaurant/bar.
likes.disliked: — Small, location wasn't too convenient for my purposes.

reviews.text: The great thing about Shinjuku is, if I recall correctly, it's one stop from Harajuku - containing the Meiji Shrine, youth-oriented fashion shopping and lots of places to eat and party - Shibuya and so forth so it's a good place to be based. I have to say though, Shinjuku itself appeared to me more like a business district so those wanting to party into the night and drunkenly stumble back to their hotels after the last train (which departs shortly after midnight) might consider staying in the more party-oriented districts like Ginza, Shibuya and Roppongi because taxis are very expensive in Tokyo.
reviews.title: Super Hotel
Good hotel and location
reviews.text: The hotel has a beautiful warm and welcoming lobby with a great restaurant/bar downstairs. Breakfast at the restaurant is top-class, which, if remember correctly, cost about 1400yen/person. Hotel staff are friendly and very helpful but that's the norm in Japan. I stayed in a standard double room and they are very small. It has everything you need - bed, tv, bathroom - and is very clean. Compact rooms are the norm in Japan but those wanting a bit more leg room might consider springing for more luxurious suites at other hotels. The strange thing was the view outside my room was straight into the men's room of the neighbouring business skyscraper, which was quite funny.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, this hotel contains absolutely everything you will need for a pleasant and comfortable stay. My only qualm is the location didn't really suit the purposes of my visit, although this is probably due to my lack of research into Tokyo before I booked rather than any flaw attributed to the hotel itself.
reviews.title: Quality Hotel & Location

likes.disliked: — Bed Pillow was as hard as a rock ...

reviews.text: I was in Japan for two weeks this summer and spent a whole week in Tokyo at this hotel. We actually arrived at this hotel first, then left for a week to travel around Japan before returning to the hotel for our week in Tokyo. The hotel stored our luggage that we didn't need while traveling around that first week, which was a wonderful convenience. If you are going to Tokyo, this is the place to stay. First, you can take the Airport Limosine service straight from Narita airport to the front door of the hotel (and back again when you leave). Shinjuku station is only about a five minute walk from the hotel, but check your subway map and where you are going because the entrance for the Oedo line is immediately to your right as you leave the hotel. Everything in the city is a short subway or train ride from Shinjuku making it a nice centralized location. There are also several department stores nearby (Odakyu, Keio, Isetan and Takashimaya). As for the hotel itself, it is a very beautiful, modern hotel. Everything was extremely clean and the sevice that you get in Japan can't compare to anywhere else in the world. All amenities were modern, with a refridgerator in the room and a very comfortable bed. There is a lounge area on the second floor with free internet access, coffee and tea. Yes the rooms are a bit small (I had a single room) but that is to be expec ted in Japan. And come on, you're in Tokyo, how much time do you really want to spend in your hotel room? I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely be staying here again the next time I visit Japan.
reviews.title: Wonderful and Convenient Hotel!

likes.liked: — It's cleanliness and close proximity to cultural sites

reviews.text: I had a little trouble looking for this hotel location but with the help from information counter in Takashimaya mall, I found it. It's very important that once you reach Shinjuku Station, use the right exit or you will end up going in circle. Use New Southern Terrace exit. Once out of the exit go to the left and walk straight, you'll see starbuck. Keep walking until you see crispy creme on the left and u will go to the right (you will go through some stairs). Keep going down the stairs and you will see the hotel right in front of you.
reviews.title: Will definitely come back here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The check in time is 2 pm, since I arrived early I left my luggage at the check in counter and went for a walk. You can always ask for information from the hotel staff, they do speak english, they will provide you with map if needed.
reviews.title: Loved Hotel Sunroute Shinjuku

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room:
reviews.title: A definite Gem

reviews.text: The room is small but very tidy. The only down side was we got a room facing man's toilet. Not a very pleasant view. The hotel provide basic amenities like kettle, tv (flat screen), toiletries, they even provide clean slippers and sleeping robe (I don't know what it's called) everyday. Internet is free but bring your own laptop.
reviews.title: Everything as described in the Review

description: Hotel Sunroute Plaza Shinjuku is a chic hotel located in the busy Shinjuku business district of Tokyo Japan. Newly renovated in 2007 with sleek lines and modern accents. The guestrooms are both contemporary and inviting for business and leisure travelers. At the confluence of corporate skyscrapers and subway stations It is a magnet for business travelers. Travel around the Shinjuku and Tokyo area effortlessly via high-speed public transportation which is just minutes away by foot. Shop one of the many department stores or travel outward to Mt. Fuji and the greater Tokyo area. It invites guests and visitors to lounge in the Villazza restaurant and trattoria for an expertly prepared meal from a menu featuring traditional Italian fare. Unwind at the end of the day in our Shinjuku hotel at Bar Ku Kon in the plush lounges lit by a crackling fire while sipping on a premium cocktail or whiskey with colleagues or friends.
